bullets: • The iPhone Air is Apple’s first dip into ultra-thin phones, and may be a precursor to the rumored foldable iPhone
• The Air reportedly accounted for about 10 to 15 percent of all production orders projected for the iPhone 17 lineup
• Apple is reportedly notifying its supply chain partners of plans to scale back production

items.title: The weather disaster database that Trump killed has a new home
bullets: • National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) have shared data and insights on billion-dollar disasters dating back to 1980 on a federal website
• NCEI stopped updating that resource in May, “in alignment with evolving priorities, statutory mandates, and staffing changes” under the Trump administration

items.title: Margins of Error
bullets: • This season on Margins of Error, Harry teases out big ideas like what accents say about where we live, how much money it takes to be happy, and whether the U.S
• should finally switch to the metric system
• Harry talks to some very smart people who are doing their best to optimize the way we travel

items.title: 0% intro APR until 2024 is 100% insane
bullets: • The Wells Fargo Reflect® Card is designed for people who want some breathing room from interest
• It offers an incredible 0% intro APR for 21 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers
• The card doesn't pile on extras like rewards, but if your goal is to stop interest in its tracks, it's a slam dunk

• The key question is how well it will perform over the long run

items.title: Theater counts: Tron stays on top, widest release locked for second weekend
bullets: • Tron: Ares claimed the top spot at the weekend box office, pulling in $33.24 million

• New this weekend is the 1980’s-set supernatural horror sequel, Black Phone 2

• The sci-fi action epic features an all-star cast led by Jared Leto as Ares, a super-intelligent entity torn between his programmed directives and the emergence of emotions
